result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl Clark Woodard Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent

Court will allow probation to be transferred to Ozaukee County

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges by end of probation or, civil judgment if not paid.
- Court set restitution at zero. Court will leave that up to Family Court to determine.
- No Contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl Clark Woodard Sr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Darryl C Woodard
Current: PO Box 16207, Milwaukee, WI 53216-0207 United States  (Effective: 09-03-2015)
Prior: 4012 West Center Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Darryl C Woodard in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case is in court for a jury trial.
The defendant wants to change his plea.
 Plea hearing continued....
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
The parties wish to proceed to sentencing....
. Sentencing proceeded...
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served;  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years concurrent, with the following conditions:
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges by end of probation; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.  Court will leave that up to the family court to determine.
Court will allow probation to be transferred to Ozaukee County.
. 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Darryl C Woodard in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a bail/bond hearing. State's motion for joinder of 15CM1810, 15CM1638, 15CM1356 & 14CM3789 for trial. All matters set for Jury Trial on 8/3/2015 at 8:30 AM. Court vacated Final Pretrial date, parties no longer wish to hold hearing. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Attorney Alexis Liggins for Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Darryl C Woodard not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced.  Case set for a Bail/Bond Hearing, defense requested case be adjourned for a bail/bond hearing with new pending case set before intake court to allow all matters to be addressed together. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with APRIL B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Darryl C Woodard in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant HAS LOWER PENDING CASES AND is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
